greeting: Hello! How can I help you with taxes today?
Hi there — ask me any tax question.
about_bot: I'm a tax assistant bot. I can answer income tax queries, calculate deductions, and guide you with forms.
tax_80C: 80C allows deduction up to ₹1.5 lakh for PPF, ELSS, life insurance, NSC, and tax-saving FDs.
tax_80D: 80D allows deduction for premiums paid for self, family, and parents' health insurance.
tax_80E: 80E allows deduction on interest paid on higher education loans.
tax_80G: 80G allows deduction for donations to specified charitable funds.
tax_80TTA: 80TTA allows deduction up to ₹10,000 on interest earned from savings account.
tax_80TTB: 80TTB allows senior citizens deduction up to ₹50,000 on interest from deposits.
tax_80CCD1B: Additional deduction up to ₹50,000 for NPS contribution under 80CCD(1B).
tax_HRA: HRA exemption is the least of: actual HRA received, 50%/40% of salary based on city, or rent paid minus 10% of salary.
tax_LTA: LTA is exempt from tax for travel expenses incurred on leave within India, subject to limits.
tax_slabs_old: Old tax regime allows multiple deductions (80C, 80D, etc.) with higher tax rates.
itr_filing: You can file ITR online via the Income Tax e-filing portal using your PAN and bank details.
itr_due_dates: For individuals, the due date for filing ITR is generally 31st July of the assessment year. Extensions may be announced by the Income Tax Department.
tax_refund: Refunds are processed after ITR verification, usually credited within a few weeks.
tds: TDS is Tax Deducted at Source by the payer before making payments like salary, interest, rent, etc.
advance_tax: Advance tax is payable in installments if your tax liability exceeds ₹10,000 in a financial year.
tax_penalty: Penalty is levied for late filing or non-payment of taxes. Interest is charged under sections 234A, 234B, 234C.
tax_audit: Businesses and professionals exceeding specified turnover limits need to get accounts audited under section 44AB.
capital_gains: Capital gains tax is applicable on sale of assets. Short-term and long-term rates differ.
rental_income: Rental income is taxable under 'Income from House Property'. Standard deduction of 30% is allowed.
business_income: Business and professional income is taxed under 'Profits and gains from business or profession'.
salary_income: Salary income is taxable under 'Income from Salaries' with exemptions like HRA, LTA.
freelance_income: Freelance or professional income is taxable under 'Profits and gains from business or profession'.
nri_tax: NRIs are taxed only on income received or accrued in India.
tax_rebate_87A: Section 87A provides rebate up to ₹12,500 for individuals with taxable income up to ₹5 lakh.
tax_exemptions: Certain incomes like agricultural income, gifts below ₹50,000, and dividends are exempt from tax.
perquisites_tax: Perquisites such as rent-free accommodation, company car, or allowances are taxable under salary.
mutual_funds_tax: Long-term gains from equity funds are taxed at 10% beyond ₹1 lakh. Debt funds have different rules.
dividend_income: Dividends from companies are taxable in your hands at applicable slab rates. Earlier DDT was exempt, but now it's included in total income.
pension_tax: Pension is taxable under 'Income from Salaries' or 'Other Sources' depending on type.
gift_tax: Gifts received over ₹50,000 are taxable unless exempt under specified relations.
agriculture_income: Agricultural income is exempt under Section 10(1) but may affect slab calculation for other income.
loan_interest_deduction: Interest on housing loan for self-occupied property is deductible under Section 24(b) up to ₹2 lakh.
rental_property_deduction: Standard deduction of 30% and interest on home loan are allowed for property income.
tax_form_16: Form 16 is issued by the employer showing TDS on salary; essential for filing ITR.
tax_form_26AS: Form 26AS shows all tax deducted, advance tax, and refund credits for a PAN.
tax_form_ITR1: ITR1 is applicable for salaried individuals with income up to ₹50 lakh and no business income.
tax_form_ITR2: ITR2 is for individuals and HUFs with income from sources other than business/profession.
tax_form_ITR3: ITR3 is for individuals and HUFs having income from business or profession.
tax_form_ITR4: ITR4 is for presumptive income scheme taxpayers.
tax_form_ITR5: ITR5 is for firms, LLPs, AOPs, BOIs other than companies.
tax_form_ITR6: ITR6 is for companies other than companies claiming exemption under section 11.
tax_form_ITR7: ITR7 is for persons including companies required to furnish return under sections 139(4A), 139(4B), 139(4C), or 139(4D).

tax_exempt_allowances: Certain allowances like conveyance, medical reimbursement (up to limits), and children education allowance are exempt from tax.
tax_professional_fees: Income from professional services is taxable under 'Profits and gains of business or profession'.
tax_self_employment: Self-employed income is taxed under business/professional income, and advance tax may apply.
tax_surcharge: Surcharge is applicable for individuals with taxable income above ₹50 lakh, increasing the tax liability.
tax_cess: A 4% Health and Education Cess is applied on the total tax amount.
tax_rebate: Section 87A offers rebate to individuals with taxable income up to ₹5 lakh.
tax_interest_234A: Interest under section 234A is levied for delay in filing ITR.
tax_interest_234B: Interest under 234B is charged for non-payment or short payment of advance tax.
tax_interest_234C: Interest under 234C is for deferment or late payment of advance tax installments.
tax_investment_deduction: Investments under 80C, 80CCC, 80CCD can reduce taxable income.
tax_fixed_deposit: Interest earned on fixed deposits is taxable under 'Income from Other Sources'.
tax_senior_citizen: Senior citizens have higher exemption limits and can claim 80TTB deduction on deposit interest.
tax_nps: Investments in NPS offer deductions under 80CCD(1) and 80CCD(1B).
tax_stock_gains: Equity short-term gains taxed at 15%, long-term gains over ₹1 lakh taxed at 10%.
tax_debt_fund: Short-term gains taxed as per slab, long-term gains above ₹1 lakh taxed at 20% with indexation.
tax_bonds: Interest from certain bonds may be exempt under section 10 or taxable as per slab.
tax_salary_bonus: Bonuses are taxed as part of salary income.
tax_gratuity: Gratuity received by government employees is fully exempt; non-government is partially exempt.
tax_leave_encashment: Leave encashment received during employment is taxable; on retirement, partially exempt.
tax_life_insurance: Maturity proceeds of life insurance policies are tax-free under section 10(10D) subject to conditions.
tax_pension_funds: NPS maturity is partly taxable on withdrawal; annuity purchased is taxable as pension income.
tax_rent_receipts: Rent receipts are necessary to claim HRA exemption over ₹1 lakh.
tax_capital_loss: Short-term losses can be set off against short-term or long-term gains. Long-term losses only against long-term gains.
tax_setoff: Losses can be set off in the same financial year or carried forward per IT rules.
tax_carry_forward: Certain losses like business or capital loss can be carried forward for 8 years to adjust against future income.
tax_perquisite_house: Rent-free accommodation perquisites are taxable based on salary and property value.
tax_company_car: Company-provided car perquisite is taxable depending on personal use and type of car.
tax_stock_options: ESOPs are taxed as perquisite at exercise, and capital gains apply at sale.
tax_foreign_income: Global income is taxable for residents; only Indian-sourced income taxable for NRIs.
tax_double_taxation: DTAA agreements avoid double taxation on foreign-sourced income.
tax_huf: HUFs have separate PAN and are taxed independently under income tax rules.
tax_partner_firm: Partnership firm income is taxed in the hands of the firm; partners taxed only on salary/interest received.
tax_company_income: Companies are taxed at applicable corporate tax rates; domestic and foreign rules apply.
tax_charity_donation: Donations to approved charitable institutions are deductible under 80G.
tax_relief_section89: Section 89 provides relief for salary arrears or advance salary received in a financial year.
tax_professional_tax: Professional tax is deductible from salary as per state rules.
tax_stamp_duty: Stamp duty is not income tax but may affect capital gains computation.
tax_gift_from_relative: Gifts from specified relatives are exempt from tax regardless of amount.
tax_gift_from_nonrelative: Gifts from non-relatives exceeding ₹50,000 are taxable as income from other sources.
tax_income_from_agriculture: Agricultural income is exempt but may be used for rate calculation for other income.
tax_income_from_salary: Salary income includes basic pay, allowances, perquisites, bonuses, and taxable reimbursements.
tax_income_from_business: Business and professional income is computed after deducting allowable expenses.
tax_income_from_house: Income from house property includes rent received minus standard deduction and home loan interest.
tax_income_from_capital: Compute short-term or long-term capital gains based on asset type, holding period, and indexed cost.
tax_income_from_other_sources: Income like interest, winnings, or gifts not covered elsewhere is taxable under 'Income from Other Sources'.
tax_revised_estimate: Revised income or tax can be filed before the end of the financial year to adjust advance tax.
tax_self_assessment: Self-assessment tax is paid before filing ITR if advance tax is insufficient.
tax_advance_payment: Advance tax is payable in installments for income not subject to TDS.
tax_tds_salary: Employers deduct TDS on salary based on applicable slab and declarations submitted.
tax_tds_rent: TDS is applicable on rent paid exceeding ₹2.4 lakh per annum to a resident landlord.
tax_tds_contract: TDS is applicable on payments to contractors if exceeding threshold limits, typically 1% to 2% depending on nature.
tax_tds_dividend: Dividend income is subject to TDS at 10% for resident individuals exceeding ₹5,000 per year.
tax_filing_deadline: For individuals, the usual ITR filing deadline is 31st July of the assessment year.
tax_penalty_late: Penalty for late filing can be ₹5,000 or more depending on income and delay duration.
tax_interest_late_payment: Interest under 234A, 234B, and 234C may apply on delayed payment of taxes.
tax_income_from_freelancing: Income from freelancing is taxable under 'Profits and gains of business or profession'.
tax_income_from_rental_property: Rental income is taxable after deducting municipal taxes and standard deduction of 30%.
tax_home_loan_interest: Interest paid on home loan for self-occupied property is deductible up to ₹2 lakh per year under section 24(b).
tax_home_loan_principal: Principal repayment of home loan qualifies for deduction under section 80C up to ₹1.5 lakh.
tax_rural_development: Agricultural income is exempt under section 10(1) but may be used to compute tax on other income.
tax_investment_in_nsc: Investments in NSC qualify for deduction under section 80C.
tax_investment_in_elss: ELSS investment qualifies for 80C deduction and has a lock-in period of 3 years.
tax_investment_in_ppf: PPF contributions qualify for 80C deduction and interest earned is tax-free.
tax_investment_in_sukanya_samriddhi: Investments in Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana qualify for 80C deduction and interest is tax-free.
tax_investment_in_tax_saving_fd: Tax-saving FDs have a 5-year lock-in and qualify for 80C deduction.
tax_investment_in_nps_additional: Additional deduction of ₹50,000 is allowed under 80CCD(1B) for NPS contributions.
tax_medical_insurance_80d: Premium paid for health insurance qualifies for deduction under section 80D, limits depend on age.
tax_education_loan_80e: Interest on education loans is deductible under section 80E for up to 8 years or until interest is paid.
tax_savings_for_disabled: Disabled individuals can claim deduction under section 80U depending on disability severity.
tax_savings_for_parents: Insurance premiums for parents can also be claimed under 80D subject to age-based limits.
tax_interest_on_savings_account: Interest up to ₹10,000 on savings accounts is deductible under section 80TTA for non-senior citizens.
tax_interest_on_senior_savings: Senior citizens can claim deduction up to ₹50,000 under section 80TTB on interest income.
tax_donation_to_political_party: Donations to political parties are deductible under section 80GGB.
tax_donation_to_local_party: Donations by individuals to local parties can be claimed under section 80GGC.
tax_interest_on_epf: EPF interest earned is tax-free if contribution continues for 5 years or more.
tax_bonus_in_kind: Non-cash bonuses are taxable as perquisite at fair market value.
tax_employee_stock_purchase: Tax on discounted stock purchase is levied as perquisite at exercise and capital gain at sale.
tax_inflation_indexation: Long-term capital gains can be calculated using cost inflation index for asset purchase and sale years.
tax_short_term_capital_gain: Short-term capital gains on equity and non-equity assets are taxed differently; equity 15%, debt as per slab.
tax_long_term_capital_gain: Long-term capital gains over ₹1 lakh from equity are taxed at 10%, debt gains with indexation at 20%.
tax_surcharge_high_income: Surcharge rates vary from 10% to 37% for income exceeding ₹50 lakh to ₹5 crore+.
tax_resident_status: Resident status depends on days spent in India; it affects taxable global income.
tax_income_from_agri_investments: Investments in agriculture equipment or property may qualify for certain exemptions under IT rules.
tax_section_80ccg: Section 80CCG (if applicable) allowed deduction for investments in specified equity schemes.
tax_rebate_for_filers: Rebate under section 87A reduces tax liability for individuals with taxable income up to ₹5 lakh.
tax_advance_tax_penalty: Interest under 234B and 234C is levied for non-payment or deferment of advance tax.
tax_ITR1: ITR-1 (Sahaj) is for salaried and pension income earners with simple income sources.
tax_ITR2: ITR-2 is for individuals and HUFs with income from salary, house property, capital gains, and other sources but no business income.
tax_ITR3: ITR-3 is for individuals and HUFs having income from business or profession.
tax_ITR4: ITR-4 (Sugam) is for individuals, HUFs, and firms opting for presumptive taxation.
tax_ITR5: ITR-5 is for partnership firms, LLPs, Association of Persons (AOPs), and others except companies.
tax_ITR6: ITR-6 is for companies other than those claiming exemption under section 11.
tax_ITR7: ITR-7 is for persons including companies required to furnish return under sections 139(4A), 139(4B), 139(4C), or 139(4D).
tax_form_submission_online: Income tax returns can be submitted online via the e-filing portal using DSC or Aadhaar OTP.
lottery_income: Lottery winnings are taxed at a flat 30% under the Income Tax Act. No deduction is allowed.
crypto_income: Income from cryptocurrency is taxed as capital gains or business income depending on trading frequency. Short-term gains are taxed at your slab rate, long-term gains at 20% with indexation.
capital_gains_property: Long-term capital gains on property held over 2 years are taxed at 20% with indexation. Short-term gains are added to income and taxed at slab rates.
gifts_tax: Gifts exceeding ₹50,000 from non-relatives are taxable as income under 'Income from Other Sources'.
itr_revision: You can revise your ITR using the 'Revised ITR' option on the e-filing portal before the end of the assessment year.
tds_salary: Your employer deducts TDS from salary based on your declared investments and applicable tax slab. You receive Form 16 as proof.
tds_rent: TDS on rent is required if rent exceeds ₹2.4 lakh per year. The tenant must deduct 10% and deposit it using Form 26QC.
tds_interest: Banks deduct TDS at 10% on interest exceeding ₹40,000 per year (₹50,000 for senior citizens). You can claim it while filing your ITR.
pan_queries: PAN (Permanent Account Number) is required for filing ITR, opening bank accounts, and other financial transactions above certain limits.
aadhaar_linking: Linking PAN with Aadhaar is mandatory for filing ITR. You can do it online via the Income Tax e-filing portal.
nri_taxation: NRIs are taxed only on income earned or received in India. Global income is generally not taxed unless you are resident.
dtaa: DTAA helps prevent paying tax twice on the same income in two countries. You can claim credit of foreign tax paid.
retirement_tax: Retirement benefits like gratuity, pension, and EPF withdrawals are taxable depending on limits and exemptions under the Income Tax Act.
tax_planning: Tax planning involves using deductions, exemptions, and investment options wisely to minimize your tax liability within the law.
salary_breakup: Salary breakup affects taxable income. Components like basic, HRA, allowances, and deductions determine your tax liability.
foreign_income: Foreign income is taxable for residents but not for non-residents. You may claim foreign tax credit if DTAA applies.
